CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 3, 1954, pg. 1, reads: "Promise Probe - At a conference Wednesday morning, Coroner William McClelland promised to conduct an 'open inquest' into the 'suicide' of Aloysious Spalding, who police say, strangled himself to death in a cell at No. 1 police station Sunday night. Coroner McClelland is seated at left, talking to Atty. Richard F. Jones, NAACP president, center, and James McCoy, Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League, right. Standing is Joseph Aldisert, first assistant chief deputy coroner. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: First assistant chief deputy coroner Joseph Aldisert, coroner William McClelland, NAACP president Atty. Richard F. Jones, and James McCoy of Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League, gathered in office
